Articles.Content: The Aerospike seems to have been left out of getting renamed in 1.0. I guess "Aerospike" is considered the name, but that is more the type of engine rather than a nickname. I propose "Sharptooth".
Maybe Bulldog? The others have a dog theme.

Spike. Even fits a dog theme, as people name their dogs Spike.

Also, I just mainlined most of Buffy and Angel over the past month. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
NASA's aerospike engine tests were called the Dryden Aerospike Rocket Test (D.A.R.T.). I think it should be called the Dart.
Or maybe Bullseye? Sort of like the RAPIER is a take off of a SABRE it's real life equivalent
Why not "T-1 Toroidal Aerospike "Javelin" Liquid Fuel Engine". Aerospike seems to fit just fine at the moment though; it's enough of an odd aerospace engine to warrant the mundane name.
Giving a nickname to the aerospike is like giving a name to the RAPIER.
"Aerospike" is now the nickname - because I've a sneaking suspicion it's not a real aerospike.
